item.title: DNS records of 1% .fi domains exposed through Zone Transfers
item.description: DNS records of 1% .fi domains exposed through Zone Transfers DNS Zone Transfer is a mechanism for administrators to replicate DNS datasets across DNS servers. If it is enabled for a DNS nameserver, the nameserver will gladly give all DNS data regarding a domain to anyone who asks. Enabling Zone Transfers will cause an information disclosure and can thus be considered misconfiguration. I decided to investigate how common this nameserver misconfiguration is by doing a zone transfer query on all .
